elements.text:
After creating an external party, I sent 3 Canton Coin to it using a transfer offer.
When I am using the
CLI tool
, I am able to see my 3 Canton Coin:
But when I try to get the external party balance through the validator API, I get an 404 Error:
get /api/validator/v0/admin/external-party/balance?party_id=dfnsdev1::12208909c68165821e51dc034ba345df96c306c30463b19dca388875e5ce62851fc8
{"error":"No wallet for external party dfnsdev1::12208909c681..."}
Is the validator API to get the external balance deprecated?

text:
not that I am aware of.
I have noticed before that this endpoint would return 404 if I did not pre-approve canton coin transfers for this external party.

elements.text:
not that I am aware of.
I have noticed before that this endpoint would return 404 if I did not pre-approve canton coin transfers for this external party.

text: for this external party the goal was to not pre-approve canton coin transfers, and use transfer offer only

elements.text: for this external party the goal was to not pre-approve canton coin transfers, and use transfer offer only

text:
what is the plan long term? I feel it should somehow work for this use case?
I can use the standard token listing API in the meantime though

elements.text:
what is the plan long term? I feel it should somehow work for this use case?
I can use the standard token listing API in the meantime though

text: So this is implicitly done when calling `/v0/admin/external-party/transfer-preapproval/prepare-send` ?

elements.text: So this is implicitly done when calling
/v0/admin/external-party/transfer-preapproval/prepare-send

text: or this is basically the only thing that it is doing?

elements.text: or this is basically the only thing that it is doing?

text: got it! Thanks!

elements.text: got it! Thanks!

text: the active contracts endpoint on ledger API? Or ACS on the scan api? The active contracts on ledger API requires corresponding party's JWT which I won't have on my centralized backend

elements.text: the active contracts endpoint on ledger API? Or ACS on the scan api? The active contracts on ledger API requires corresponding party's JWT which I won't have on my centralized backend

text: I only need contract id but I think the scan is still too delayed and id need to have a retry loop to mitigate against spent amulet race condition

elements.text: I only need contract id but I think the scan is still too delayed and id need to have a retry loop to mitigate against spent amulet race condition

text: So yea will probably just go with locking

elements.text: So yea will probably just go with locking

includes all the users keys?

so the validator node identities are backup using <http://localhost:80/api/validator/v0/admin/participant/identities>

what about the new user account? does I need to backup it?

text: what's the best practice for estimating traffic cost of a transaction? I know there's a rate per mb but getting the actual size in mb

text: <@UEHLS0JUB> Reviving this thread a bit. Consider a typical application consuming the transaction stream and persisting the offset to resume on restarts. How should one cope with these migrations? Or can the old offset still be relied on even between migrations?

elements.text: Reviving this thread a bit. Consider a typical application consuming the transaction stream and persisting the offset to resume on restarts. How should one cope with these migrations? Or can the old offset still be relied on even between migrations?

text: Then what’s the way to do it?

elements.text: Then what’s the way to do it?

text: Right, but ideally you would like to avoid duplicates

elements.text: Right, but ideally you would like to avoid duplicates

text: I’m considering the typical case of an app that is just folding the transaction stream into its own state

elements.text: I’m considering the typical case of an app that is just folding the transaction stream into its own state

text: Not talking about preserving history

elements.text: Not talking about preserving history

text: Not possible if your state depends on the transactions

text: e.g. imagine you’re counting the fees paid on your transfers

text: Is there a foolproof way to tell when you’re at the same spot? Like some snapshot id or something

elements.text: Is there a foolproof way to tell when you’re at the same spot? Like some snapshot id or something

text: And how do you ensure you fully consumed the previous stream?
